title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 18 November 2014 - XWiki
content:

11:10 <AFK\_Geek> has joined #xwiki  
11:13 <AFKGeek> has quit  
11:21 <AFK\_Geek> has quit  
12:29 <lucaa> has quit  
12:35 <AFKGeek> has joined #xwiki  
12:35 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:38 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:12 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> has joined #xwiki  
13:12 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> Hi  
13:12 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> I just installed xwiki and tested a few things  
13:12 <AFKGeek> has quit  
13:13 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> First of all it seems to be a nice wiki. Thank's for the great work. :-)  
13:13 <AFKGeek> has joined #xwiki  
13:13 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> I'm trying to configure ldap support, (i.e. ldaps)  
13:13 <AFKGeek> has quit  
13:13 <AFKGeek> has joined #xwiki  
13:14 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> I configured it in wiki.cfg set the ip and a port (it's an AD with port 636)  
13:14 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> the port ist reachable.  
13:14 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> but every time I try to login I see with tcpdump that it only connects to port 389  
13:14 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> any ideas why?  
13:15 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> I'm using the debian packages from maven.xwiki.org  
13:16 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> is there some kind of cache which should be deleted?  
13:20 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
13:27 <tmortagne> xwikiorg\_guest\_7: no there is no cache for this and setting the port is supposed to work  
13:28 <tmortagne> you just modified the existing xwiki.authentication.ldap.port in xwiki.cfg ?  
13:28 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> yes  
13:28 <tmortagne> ha but wait you modified it after starting XWiki ?  
13:29 <tmortagne> it's not exactly a cache from LDAP point of view but xwiki.cfg is loaded at startup only  
13:29 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> tmortagne: I tried to restart tomcat after each modification to xwiki.cfg  
13:29 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> I just looked up in the database and found ldap\_port in xwikistrings table with the wrong portnumber settings  
13:29 <tmortagne> did you try setting it from the UI at some point ?  
13:30 <tmortagne> this field is empty by default AFAIK  
13:30 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> rmortagne, that may be a reason. A collegue tried to install the ldap extension to modify it directly in the webinterface  
13:30 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> as far as I can tell, the extension is already deleted  
13:31 <tmortagne> yep the LDAP extension is putting the settings in the wiki  
13:31 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> but there maybe some old stuff like the database entries?  
13:31 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> Is there a way, to delete all entries created by the ldap-extension?  
13:32 <tmortagne> the extension is just UI to manipulate what already exist in standard, everything is stored in http://myhost/xwiki/bin/edit/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=object  
13:33 <tmortagne> search for LDAP fieldd and empty everything  
13:33 <tmortagne> fields  
13:36 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> tmortagne: Sorry, I'm new to xwiki, and the URL you posted points me to a page where I see 3 different "Objects". ClassSheetBinding(1),XWikiGlobalRights(3) and XWikiPreferences(1)  
13:37 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> tmortagne: there seems to be no ldap entries.  
13:37 <tmortagne> right I forgot, it's in XWikiPreferences object  
13:37 <tmortagne> click on XWikiPreferences  
13:37 <tmortagne> it will expand  
13:38 <tmortagne> that's the object containing most of the configuration at wiki level (it used to contain all the configuration at wiki level but we are trying to move stuff in dedicated places now)  
13:50 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> tmortagne: thank you very much. :-)  
13:51 <tmortagne> you're welcome  
13:51 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> tmortagne: after deleting every ldap entry and setting "ldap"-option to "none" it worked.  
13:52 <tmortagne> xwikiorg\_guest\_7: in case you did not already saw it the following link would be interesting for you: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/LDAPAuthenticationUseCases  
13:57 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> Hm, I stumbled upon the next problem.  
13:57 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> I got my configuration settings about ldap from this page:  
13:57 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-865  
13:58 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> and saw the description about placing the keystore into a specific directory.  
13:59 <Lyes> has quit  
14:00 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> regardless of the setting in xwiki.cfg: xwiki.authentication.ldap.ssl.keystore  
14:03 <Slashman> has quit  
14:05 <tmortagne> xwikiorg\_guest\_7: not a SSL expert but looks like https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E19148-01/819-4467/aeoqa/index.html is related to what you are searching  
14:06 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:08 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
14:35 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> tmortagne: I meant, that there is an option in the xwiki.cfg (xwiki.authentication.ldap.ssl.keystore), but it looks like it not used by the ssl.secure\_provider  
14:36 <tmortagne> xwikiorg\_guest\_7: as far as I understand the provide is looking at javax.net.ssl.trustStore system property and the LDAP authenticator is setting javax.net.ssl.trustStore system property to what is in xwiki.authentication.ldap.ssl.keystore  
14:37 <tmortagne> but yes you could directly set  javax.net.ssl.trustStore , probably make more sense f you have other things to set  
14:38 <tmortagne> like javax.net.ssl.trustStorePassword which is not set by the authenticator, that option should probably be removed from xwiki.cfg and replaced by some documentation about javax.net.ssl  
14:39 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> tmortagne, yes that would be nice. :-)  
14:39 <tmortagne> xwikiorg\_guest\_7: if you make all that work a suggestion of what to put in xwiki.cfg would be great ;)  
14:39 <tmortagne> (I never used SSL with LAP myself)  
14:39 <tmortagne> \*LDAP  
15:15 <msmeria> has quit  
15:42 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> thank all of you for the great work and support. :-)  
16:03 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> has quit  
16:55 <silverdrop> has quit

17:41 <tmortagne> note: all the failing test on ci are probably my fault, I'm on it  
17:41 <vmassol> ok :)  
17:56 <tmortagne> (it's fixed, will be committed as soon as oldcore build properly)
